info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 03 at 5:13PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Rutherford, Transylvania, Henderson, east central Jackson, southeastern Haywood and southeastern Buncombe Counties through 545 PM EST... At 513 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 5 miles northwest of Brevard, or near Looking Glass, moving northeast at 100 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hendersonville, Brevard, Downtown Asheville, East Asheville, Arden, Black Mountain, Mills River, Fletcher, Swannanoa and Etowah. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EST for western North Carolina.
